snippet: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include a program from Raytheon that tracks people by mining data from social media, the entrepreneur behind Google Docs...
abstract: The technology reporters and editors of The New York Times scour the Web for important and peculiar items. For Monday, selections include a program from Raytheon that tracks people by mining data from social media, the entrepreneur behind Google Docs working on business collaboration tools for mobile devices and a look at how the common interests of Apple and Samsung may outweigh their smartphone rivalry..

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: The Next Big Thing, and the Apple-Samsung Partnership
